comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See NYT article, CLEVELAND BRIDGE COLLAPSES.; Dynamite Used to Let Flood into Lock -- 25,000 Idle at Youngstown. March 26, 1913, Wednesday query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B03E1D9103CE633A... See also www.ohiohistory.org/etcetera/exhibits/swio/pages/content/... for pictures from throughout Ohio of the flood.

comment.author: 44495293@N00
comment._content: This picture depicts the steamer William Henry Mack and the West Third Street bridge, on about March 25, 1913. The incident caused $20,000 of damage to the steamer. I posted a bit more detailed commentary on the incident on my Cleveland History Blog The Lightship has, on page 7, a rather detailed history of the William Henry Mack, which was later the Valcartier.
